website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty quality and feel that features a pin extractor mechanism so you don't have to constantly hold it back when putting on a blade.
pros: Easy to use, and simple to put on and take off
Works for a range of hole saws, from 1 1/4 inches to 6 7/8 inches
Has a pin extractor mechanism for ease of blade mount
cons: The set screw that holds the pilot drill can be hard to loosen

customer_reviews.title: Rattles when engaged
customer_reviews.text: OK, I know- most users probably do not care that the two-pin engagement mechanism is always loose on the shaft. It has a ball bearing spring that allows the engaging pins to be raised and lowered so that you can thread in the spigot before engaging the pins-yet, the pins , threads, and need-to-clock for pin engagement cause the clearances needed fit to be sloppy engagement, and are not secure enough to keep it from wobbling when engaged. The threads are loose as well. I would have preferred a simple lock nut over this overengineered "quick Change junk". Now, my 4 1/8" hole is actually 4 and 3/16".
customer_reviews.author: ODD Jim

customer_reviews.title: may not be robust
customer_reviews.text: I like the heavy duty feel of it. But the motion of the outside pin part depends on tiny set screw to function. I haven't used it much and it's been sitting around for a few years. Now the pin part doesn't slide up and down as easily. Since this is not cheap, I'm wondering how long this will last. I hope it lasts at least through wiring of one house. The pilot drill is also about 2" from the holder. Not long enough for few tall hole saws. Generous 3.5" would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: ventingisok

customer_reviews.title: This is so slick, took me a minute to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so slick, took me a minute to realize the pins slide up and down. Just spin the hole saw on and slide the pin assembly into the saw, I backed off the threads to get holes and pins to align.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly durable
customer_reviews.text: This is incredibly durable and worked without any issues! Used it on a different manufacturer's hole saw and didn't have any issues with compatibility. Would definitely recommend this arbor and Milwaukee in general!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: Got to drill the screw out after it stripped the first time i tried to take the holesaw out, fixed it cuting and filing an 8/32 screw on it the go with the keyless one
customer_reviews.author: I Electrician

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I've used it on between 3" and 6" hole saw's. It's extremely supportive and easy to take on and off.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I've used it on between 3" and 6" hole saw's. It's extremely supportive and easy to take on and off.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy arbor that is well machined. I have other arbors but this is the best of them.
customer_reviews.author: avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Possibly defective
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first time I used it. I went and bought another brand from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: JessieLeigh

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Bought to replace one I dropped in ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality.Bought to replace one I dropped in a wall. Got the 3/8 shank this time so I could use my 3/8 drill without a 1/2 inch adapter
customer_reviews.author: Mike in GA

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee's Best
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for one that I broke. I expect it to work a well as the first.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D'Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This arbor is great for large and small hole saws alike - The quick change feature allows one to switch out hole saws in an instant
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pastel

product_meta.title: MILWAUKEE ELEC TOOL 49-56-7250 3 or 8 Lg Quickchang Arbor,
product_meta.description: 3 or 8", large, quick change, hole saw arbor, no adapters required, fits all hole saws 1-1 or 4" and larger, fits all drill chucks 3 or 8" and larger.
